=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Here’s a plain‐language breakdown and some ideas for how to approach the game:

1. Game Genre & Theme
 • It’s a space‐themed arcade shooter. You control a spaceship (the “avatar”), and your foes are alien craft and bombs coming from offscreen spawn points (“portals”).

2. Core Mechanics
 • You maneuver your spaceship (avatar) around the play area. When you reach the screen’s edge (EOS), there’s a little “step back” so you don’t leave the field.
 • You fire projectiles (“sam” and “missile”) to hit enemy aliens. Your shots give you points when they hit aliens, but collisions with enemies or their bombs will cost you points.
 • Enemies: The “alien” sprites act as bombers – they move towards you and occasionally drop bombs. These bombs travel downward.
 • The game has designated spawn points (portalsSlow and portalsFast) that generate groups of aliens. Once all aliens and their spawn points are cleared, you win.
 • There’s a “base” object that appears to have special interactions. For example, a sam bullet hitting the base awards points, and bomb collisions with the base destroy both.
 • Different collision interactions determine outcomes: sometimes both sprites are removed (for example, when a bomb hits the base), and sometimes only one is killed. Your score may increase or decrease based on which sprites interact.

3. Objective & Win/Loss Conditions
 • The main goal is to survive by keeping your avatar intact. If your spaceship is destroyed (sprite count of avatar reaches 0), you lose.
 • To win, you need to stop the onslaught: eliminate all enemy aliens and clear the portals (their counter reaches 0). That is, make sure that no enemy aliens are left spawnable.
 • Points are awarded for shooting aliens (with sam and missile), but colliding with enemy bombs or aliens with your avatar will subtract from your score.

4. Suggested Strategy
 • Stay Mobile: Since your ship will “step back” on reaching the screen edge and collisions can hurt you, keep moving to dodge enemy aliens and bombs.
 • Target Priorities:
  – Focus on shooting down the aliens quickly, especially before they can drop bombs near you.
  – Consider targeting the portals (spawn points) if possible, so fewer aliens appear over time. Clearing them means you’re one step closer to victory.
 • Timing & Positioning:
  – Time your shots so that your projectiles (sam and missile) hit aliens effectively. Remember that when an alien is hit by a sam projectile, you gain extra points.
  – Avoid careless collisions: direct contact with an alien or its bomb will cost you points and make you vulnerable.
 • Manage the Battlefield:
  – The “base” might serve a secondary purpose. Since interactions with the base (like with bombs or sam) affect scoring and sprite survival, use any cover or safe zones it might provide.
  – Keep an eye on the overall count of alien forces; once you reduce both aliens and their spawn points to zero, you’ve won.

In summary, the game is about quick reactions and smart positioning. Fly your spaceship carefully, shoot down enemies while dodging their bombs, and focus on eliminating enemy spawn sources to secure your victory. Enjoy strategizing and have fun defending (or conquering) space!

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
